details.Introduction: Born 15 December 1870. Designer of furniture, jewellery, leatherwork, textiles, metalwork, and glass. Hoffmann organized the eighth Secession exhibition in Vienna in 1900. In 1903 Josef Hoffmann and Kolo Moser founded the Wiener Werkstätte, the leading Viennese craft workshop. Austrian architect, designer. Comment on works: architect

details.Introduction:
Armin Hofmann (HonRDI) (29 June 1920 – 18 December 2020) was a Swiss graphic designer. 
He began his career in 1947 as a teacher at the Allgemeine Gewerbeschule Basel School of Art and Crafts at the age of twenty-six. Hofmann followed Emil Ruder as head of the graphic design department at the Schule für Gestaltung Basel (Basel School of Design) and was instrumental in developing the graphic design style known as the Swiss Style. His teaching methods were unorthodox and broad based, setting new standards that became widely known in design education institutions throughout the world. His independent insights as an educator, married with his rich and innovative powers of visual expression, created a body of work enormously varied – books, exhibitions, stage sets, logotypes, symbols, typography, posters, sign systems, and environmental graphics. His work is recognized for its reliance on the fundamental elements of graphic form – point, line, and shape – while subtly conveying simplicity, complexity, representation, and abstraction. Originating in Russia, Germany and The Netherlands in the 1920s, stimulated by the artistic avant-garde and alongside the International Style in architecture. He is well known for his posters, which emphasized economical use of colour and fonts, in reaction to what Hofmann regarded as the "trivialization of colour."   His posters have been widely exhibited as works of art in major galleries, such as the New York Museum of Modern Art.
He was also an influential educator, retiring in 1987. In 1965 he wrote the Graphic Design Manual, a popular textbook in the field.
Hofmann died in December 2020 at the age of 100 in Lucerne, where he lived with his wife Dorothea Hofmann-Schmid.
details.Name: Armin Hofmann

details.Introduction: Hans Hofmann was an integral figure in the development of Abstract Expressionism. He studied in various art schools in Munich before moving to Paris in 1904. He returned to Munich ten years later and founded and taught his own art school from 1915 to 1930, then immigrated to the United States. In 1933, he opened a school in New York, and a year later, he had established the Hans Hofmann School of Fine Arts in New York and another school in Massachusetts. By 1958, he had gained a huge reputation as a teacher and turned to painting full-time. Hofmann is best known for his paintings of solid color blocks on fragmented backgrounds. German architect, Nürberg. Comment on works: abstract
details.Names: Hans Hofmann, Hans Hoffman, Johann Hofmann, Hans Georg Albert Hofmann, Johann Georg Albert Hofmann, Hofmann

details.Introduction: One of the founding members of the Czech modernist movement. He studied at the Prague Technical University from 1902 to 1907, and began his career in the building department of the Prague magistrate. He was a member of the Artěl Cooperative, the Mánes Association of Plastic Artists, and the Group of Plastic Artists. He embraced a variety of creative outlets and was, variously, a writer, architect, scenographer, and painter. Czech architect, painter, graphic artist.
details.Roles: Artist, Architect, Writer, Designer, Graphic Designer, Illustrator, Painter, Theorist

details.Introduction: Ludwig Hohlwein (27 July 1874 in Wiesbaden – 15 September 1949 in Berchtesgaden) was a German poster artist, a pioneer of the Sachplakat style. He trained and practiced as an architect in Munich until 1911, when he moved to Berlin and switched to poster design.
details.Roles: Artist, Architect, Interior Decorator, Designer, Graphic Artist, Painter
details.Name: Ludwig Hohlwein
